name: Rovaniemi
fun_fact: Fun fact: Rovaniemi is the official hometown of Santa Claus - you can visit Santa Claus Village right on the Arctic Circle, where Santa receives over 500,000 letters per year from children worldwide, and you can cross the magical Arctic Circle line any day of the year!

hero_dishes.origin_story: The signature dish of Lapland - reindeer herding is central to Sami culture. The meat is thinly sliced and cooked in butter
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Arctic Boulevard, Nili Restaurant, Gustav Kitchen & Bar

hero_dishes.name: Kalakukko
hero_dishes.description: Fish baked inside a rye bread loaf - the bread becomes the container
hero_dishes.origin_story: Originally Finnish miners' lunch - the bread kept the fish fresh and edible for days

hero_dishes.name: Lohikeitto
hero_dishes.description: Creamy salmon soup with potatoes, carrots, and dill
hero_dishes.origin_story: Finland's quintessential comfort food - perfect for warming up after time in the Arctic cold
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Nearly every restaurant serves this Finnish classic

hero_dishes.name: Arctic Berries
hero_dishes.description: Wild cloudberries, lingonberries, and bilberries foraged from the Arctic wilderness
hero_dishes.origin_story: The midnight sun produces incredibly sweet berries - cloudberries (lakka) are Arctic gold
hero_dishes.where_to_find: On desserts throughout Rovaniemi, or forage yourself in season

signature_drinks.name: Finnish Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Finland drinks the most coffee per capita in the world - light roast, filter-brewed
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Multiple times daily during coffee breaks, often with pulla (cardamom bread)
